theme.title: Dotted 8th note
theme.para: In this lesson the dotted 8th note pattern in simple times is introduced:

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (time 2 4 noVisible) (n * e. g+)(n * s g-)(barline double) (n * q l)(n * e. g+)(n * s g-)(barline double) (n * e g+)(n * e l g-)(n * e. g+)(n * s g-)(barline end) )))

part.title: Listen and take notice of the differences
part.para: Note how the rhythm of dotted 8th note can be obtained from one 8th note and two 16th notes, when tying the 8th note.
Always that you find a trouble with a rhythmic pattern, study it first without the ties. When learned without the ties it will be easier to learn the original one with ties.

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (clef G)(key C)(time 2 8) (n a4 e g+)(n a4 s)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 e l g+)(n a4 s)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 e. g+)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 s g+)(n a4 s)(n a4 s)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 s l g+)(n a4 s)(n a4 s)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(n a4 s)(n a4 s g-)(barline end) )))

part.para: In a similar way you can get and learn the other patterns of this lesson:

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (clef G)(key C)(time 2 8) (n a4 q)(n a4 e. g+)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 q l)(n a4 e. g+)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(n a4 e g-)(n a4 e. g+)(n a4 s g-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(n a4 e l g-)(n a4 e. g+)(n a4 s g-)(barline end) )))

part.title: Exercises
part.para: Exercise 1 - Train your ear: the dotted 8th note pattern.
Exercise 2 - Train your ear: a quarter note tied to a dotted 8th note.
Exercise 3 - Train your ear: Group of two 8th notes tied to a dotted 8th note.
Exercise 4 - Read scores containing the rhythms studied in this lesson.
